headline.main: SARATOGA.; Life and Manners at Saratoga--Notes of Society--A Lady of the Old School.

docs.lead_paragraph: If it were of any use, we would say to the people who have not yet come, but are thinking of coming to Saratoga, "stay away," for we are already so full, so jammed, packed and crowded, that there is not room for another of the smallest specimens of humanity your giant city, so productive of dwarfs, can send forth. "Never before so many." is the continual utterance, and still they come. "Why?"

headline.main: FROM KANSAS.; Condition of Affairs in Lawrence--Citizens Assaulted on the Highway--Outrages upon Free-State Men--A Vigilance Committee Proposed--New Development of Squatter Sovereignty.

docs.lead_paragraph: An uneasy quiet, boding dire ill, just now, rests upon us. Movements of great importance to the peace of our Territory are on foot, and your readers must not be at all surprised to be soon informed of another development of Squatter Sovereignty.
docs.snippet: An uneasy quiet, boding dire ill, just now, rests upon us. Movements of great importance to the peace of our Territory are on foot, and your readers must not be at all surprised to be soon informed of another development of Squatter Sovereignty.

headline.main: AGRICULTURAL.; The Breadstuffs, Provision and Other Produce Markets--General Agricultural Intelligence..

docs.lead_paragraph: We have had very boisterous weather in this locality, within the past week. Hence, business has been less vigorous, though it exhibits no remarkable changes. The latest accounts from Europe are encouraging to factors of Breadstuffs, and these are held with considerable firmness, though they are not very freely purchased. Desirable lots are not easily procured.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE YELLOW FEVER. The Commissioners of Emigration held their regular weekly meeting yesterday, when a report of all the cases of yellow fever that have occurred at Quarantine was transmitted to the Board by Dr. HARRIS, accompained with the request that it should not be published. Considerable discussion ensued, some of the Commissioners arguing that the suppression of the report would excite more alarm in the public mind than its publication.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; New-York Musical Societies on a Trip. Monthly Report of the Dispensaries. Fourth Ward School Difficulty--Attempt to Expel Mr. Hargan. A Well-Known Character Gone.

docs.lead_paragraph: The members of the Teutonia and Liederkranz Musical Societies of this City have made a pleasure trip to Niagara, which passed off with great satisfaction to all concerned. The party, all Germans, numbered 160 persons, and left the City on Saturday week, reaching the Falls Sunday noon.

headline.main: Message of the Mayor of Buffalo,; IN ANSWER TO A RESOLUTION OF THE COUNCIL CALLING UPON HIM TO RESIGN.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Common Council of the City of Buffalo: GENTLEMEN: On looking over, as it is my duty to do, your proceedings of the 21st day of July last, which were laid before me yesterday, I find the following preamble and resolution, offered by Alderman MERRIGAN, were adopted:

Louisiana Public Schools. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. Reception of Millard Fillmore. Commissioners of Health.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are happy to state that the comparatively tain attendance at the meeting of yesterday was assignable to a cause which will more than compensate for the joss of the valuable information expectedtobe elicited. The welcome rain fell in heavy and unbroken streams during the whole of the morniug, washing a vast quantity of valuable agriculturail compost through the sewers into the river.

headline.main: THE-BIBLE UNION DIFFICULTY.; Letter from Rev. Dr. Judd.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: DEAR SIR: In your paper of the 26th ult., while I was in the country, I observed a long article signed by Messrs. T. ARMITAGE, W. H. WYCKOFF, E. PARMLY, E. S. WHITNEY, C.A. BUCKBLE and S. PIER, replying to a letter of Dr. MACLAY, and making the most irrelevant and unwarrantable assults upon my conduct and character. The Genius of Avon has somewhere said:

headline.main: NEW-YOIRK CITY.; Auction Sale of the property of Mr. P. T. Barnum. Exploration of Central Africa. Sanitary Condition of the City--Raising Money to Clean the Streets. The Charges Against Comptroller Flugg. The Weather. The Baggage Express. Brick-makers' Convention. Turn Her Out. City Railroad Matters. The Late Thunder Storms, the Hot Weather, the Icehergs, main, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Special Committee, Alderman ELY Chairman, appointed by the Board of Health at its last meeting to consider some plan for raising money to provide for the deficiency in the legislative appropriation for cleaning the streets, met yesterday at the City Hall. The Chairman stated that of the $259,224 appropriated for cleaning the streets, only about $100 remained.
